Goldy is a senior project of fourth year computer science students which is a study of the effectiveness of natural language processing to elementary students.
I am made Ms. Dianne Mae Fabiano, Gian Mari G. Ramos, and Emmanuel C. Sumalabe, a group of fourth year students of Ateneo de Naga University
Ms. Dianne Mae Fabiano, Gian Mari G. Ramos, and Emmanuel C. Sumalabe, fourth year Computer Science students of Ateneo de Naga University
Ms. Dianne Mae Fabiano is a 4th year Computer Science student which is responsible for creating the user interface of Goldy.
A 4th year Computer Science student, Dianne Mae Fabiano is responsible for creating the user interface of Goldy
Mr. Gian Mari Ramos is a 4th year Computer Science student which is responsible for the development of the back-end framework of Goldy.
A 4th year Computer Science student, Gian Mari Ramos is responsible for the development of the back-end framework of Goldy.
Mr. Emmanuel Sumalabe is a 4th year Computer Science student which is responsible for the implemmentation of the dataset of Goldy.
A 4th year Computer Science student, Emmanuel Sumalabe is responsible for the implemmentation of the dataset of Goldy.
Goldy consists of sets of english modules from Grades 1 to 6 starting from school year 2020-2021 up until 2022-2023.
Goldy is programmed via Python, consists of Tailwind UI and Flask Application Management.

patterns: What are the types of nouns?
responses: There are 10 types of nouns: Common nouns, Proper nouns, Singular nouns, Plural nouns, Concrete nouns, Abstract nouns, Collective nouns, Compound nouns, Countable nouns , and Uncountable nouns.
Common nouns are words that refer to undefined or generic people, places, or things.

patterns: What are the examples of common nouns?
responses: Five examples of common nouns are: Man, Woman, Dog, Cat, Country
Proper nouns are words that help distinguish a specific person, place, or thing.
Proper nouns are words that refer to a specific person, place, or thing.

patterns: What are the examples of proper nouns?
responses: Five examples of proper nouns are names of a person, place, or thing like: Bob, Spain, Diary of a Wimpy Kid
Singular nouns are nouns that refer to only one person, place or thing.

patterns: What are the examples of singular nouns?
responses: Five examples of singular nouns are boat, house, cat, river
A plural noun are nouns that refer to more than one person, place, animal, thing, event, or idea.

patterns: What are the examples of plural nouns?
responses: Examples of plural nouns are: boats, houses, cats, dogs
A concrete noun is something that can be perceived through the five senses such as see, hear, touch, taste, or smell.
A abstract noun is something that cannot be perceived through the five senses such as see, hear, touch, taste, or smell.
A collective noun is a word that functions as a singular noun while referring to a group of people or things.
A compound noun combines two or more words into one but appears as a single word.
A compound words are formed when two words are put together to form a new word

patterns: what are the three types of compounding words
responses: we have the open compound, close compound and hypenated.

responses: are formed when two words are separated by a space but are used together to create a new word with a specific meaning.

patterns: how is an close compound formed
responses: These are formed when two words are combined to create a new word.
These are formed when two separate words are joined together by a hyphen

Known as Count Noun, it is a word that signifies counting.

A noun is a name that refers to a person, thing, animal, or event. Nouns help you name different things around you.
A singular noun means there is only one, it can be a person, thing, animal, place or event.
A plural noun means that there is more than one person, thing, animal, place, or event.

These nouns start with a small letter, and they do not begin with a capital letter.

patterns: when will I change the noun the its plural form ?
responses: for regular nouns, add s.
for singular nouns ending in s, sh, x, ch, and z, add es.
for nouns ending in y preceded by a consonant, change y to i and add es
for nouns ending in o, add s or es
Plural nouns that do not end in the letter s or es are called irregular nouns.

patterns: What are the rules of irregular noun?
responses: Some nouns form their plural form by changing their vowels.
Some nouns form their plural form by adding a syllable
Some nouns that end in f, change f to -ve and add -s
Some nouns have the same singular and plural forms.

patterns: When do I use I in a sentence ?
responses: The pronoun I is used when a person is talking about himself or herself

patterns: When do I use you in a sentence ?
responses: The pronoun You is used when you address the person you are talking to.

patterns: When do I use We in a sentence ?
responses: The pronoun we is used when you talk about yourself and another person.

patterns: When do I use they in a sentence ?
responses: The pronoun they is used when you refer to a group of people or animals
A personal pronoun is a word used as a substitute for a person's name. It takes the place of a noun.

responses: examples of singular personal pronouns are I, Me, He, She, Him, Her, and It.

responses: examples of singular personal pronouns are We, Us, and you.

responses: this can be this, these, that, and those.

responses: it is used to refer to a singular object that is near us or something that we can hold or touch.

patterns: what are these as a demonstrative noun
responses: it is used to refer to things that are more than one and are near us.

patterns: what are that as a demonstrative noun
responses: it is used to refer to a singular object that is far from us or something that we cant hold or touch

patterns: what are those as a demonstrative noun
responses: it is used to refer to things that are more than one and are far from us or something that we can't hold or touch.

patterns: what is positive degree of comparison of an adjective
responses: It is the simple form used to describe a noun or a pronoun

patterns: what is comparative degree of comparison of an adjective
responses: Add er at the end of a word to form the comparative degree. For adjectives with three or more syllables, use less or more

patterns: what is superlative degree of comparison of an adjective
responses: Add est at the end of a word to form its superlative degree. For adjectives with three or more syllables, use least or most
A verb is an action word being done by the subject in the sentence.

patterns: How do sentences in the natural order
responses: In the natural order, the subject comes first before the verb.

patterns: How do sentences in the inverted order
responses: In inverted order, the verb comes first before the subject. Most questions are in this order.
A verb is a word that shows action.
It answers the question, What is he/she doing?
A linking verb connects the subject and the predicate or other information about the subject
Tense refers to the time indicated by the verb.
Past tense indicates that the action is already done.
Present tense indicates that the action is being done at the moment.
Future tense indicates that the action will be done in the future.

patterns: What is a simple present tense ?
responses: Simple present tense is used to talk about an action which happens every day, at the moment, or habitually.
A adverb is a word that describe or modify: verbs, adverbs, and adjectives

responses: In the natural order, the subject comes first before the verb.

patterns: How do sentences in the inverted order

An imperative sentence expresses a command, request, or instruction.
An exclamatory sentence expresses strong emotions or feelings. It is often used in greetings and warnings.
A paragraph is a group of sentences that talks about one main idea or topic.
A main point is the most important message of the paragraph or text.
A main point is what the selection is mostly about.

Supporting details are major details explain and develop the main idea.
Supporting details are minor details help make the major details clear.

A graphic organizer is a teaching and learning tool used to organize information and ideas that are easy to comprehend and internalize.

A graphic organizer is a visual display that organizes ideas and shows the relationship between concepts or information. It guides readers in thinking and helping them more to comprehend what they read.

patterns: What are the examples of a reference material?
responses: Examples of reference materials are: Almanac, Encyclopedia, Index, Dictionary, Thesaurus ,Online resource/s
Reference materials are books and other reading materials that help in researching or answering questions.
An almanac contains specific facts, statistical data, and other information related to people, places, events, etc.
An encyclopedia contains basic information about a broad range of topics and is arranged alphabetically. It usually comes in volumes.
An index contains information present in periodicals, books, newspapers, etc.
A dictionary contains words of a given language and provides the definition(s), spelling, pronunciation, and the origin of a particular word.
A thesaurus is a book full of synonyms including antonyms.

patterns: What are the different kinds of text types?
responses: There are 4 types of text: Narration, Information report, Argumentative, Procedural
This type of text narrates a story and entertains its readers. Stories and novels are examples of narration. A narration has basic elements such as characters, setting, and plot.

This type of text gives information about a person, place, or thing. It provides facts on a specific topic. This can be found in reference materials such as encyclopedias, reference books, technical texts, social studies books, science books, etc.
This type of text persuades readers to believe something. An argument is the writerâ€™s reason as he/she is either 'for' or 'against' the issue.

This type of text follows a sequential order. It lists the materials to be used and the steps in a sequence. A procedural text is usually found in recipes, manuals and instructions that begin with a goal or title.
Explanation text is a text that describes how and why things work or happen.
Context clues are clues found within a sentence, paragraph, or passage that a reader can be used to understand the meaning of new or unfamiliar words.

patterns: What are the types of context clues?
responses: The types of context clues are: Synonyms, Definition, Examples, Appositive
Synonyms are words that have the same meaning.
Definition is the word is defined directly in the sentence.
The word is further explained by a noun or group of words that come after it. It is usually separated by commas in the sentence.

This type of text narrates a story and entertains its readers. Stories and novels are examples of narration. A narration has basic elements such as characters, setting, and plot.

This type of text gives information about a person, place, or thing. It provides facts on a specific topic. This can be found in reference materials such as encyclopedias, reference books, technical texts, social studies books, science books, etc.
This type of text persuades readers to believe something. An argument is the writerâ€™s reason as he/she is either 'for' or 'against' the issue.

This type of text follows a sequential order. It lists the materials to be used and the steps in a sequence. A procedural text is usually found in recipes, manuals and instructions that begin with a goal or title.
Explanation text is a text that describes how and why things work or happen.
Context clues are clues found within a sentence, paragraph, or passage that a reader can be used to understand the meaning of new or unfamiliar words.

patterns: What are the types of context clues?
responses: The types of context clues are: Synonyms, Definition, Examples, Appositive
Synonyms are words that have the same meaning.
Definition is the word is defined directly in the sentence.
The word is further explained by a noun or group of words that come after it. It is usually separated by commas in the sentence.

Goldy is a senior project of fourth year computer science students which is a study of the effectiveness of natural language processing to elementary students.
I am made Ms. Dianne Mae Fabiano, Gian Mari G. Ramos, and Emmanuel C. Sumalabe, a group of fourth year students of Ateneo de Naga University
Ms. Dianne Mae Fabiano, Gian Mari G. Ramos, and Emmanuel C. Sumalabe, fourth year Computer Science students of Ateneo de Naga University
Ms. Dianne Mae Fabiano is a 4th year Computer Science student which is responsible for creating the user interface of Goldy.
A 4th year Computer Science student, Dianne Mae Fabiano is responsible for creating the user interface of Goldy
Mr. Gian Mari Ramos is a 4th year Computer Science student which is responsible for the development of the back-end framework of Goldy.
A 4th year Computer Science student, Gian Mari Ramos is responsible for the development of the back-end framework of Goldy.
Mr. Emmanuel Sumalabe is a 4th year Computer Science student which is responsible for the implemmentation of the dataset of Goldy.
A 4th year Computer Science student, Emmanuel Sumalabe is responsible for the implemmentation of the dataset of Goldy.
Goldy consists of sets of english modules from Grades 1 to 6 starting from school year 2020-2021 up until 2022-2023.
Goldy is programmed via Python, consists of Tailwind UI and Flask Application Management.

patterns: What are the letters a, e, i, o, u called?
responses: They are called vowels

patterns: How many vowels are there in the alphabet
responses: There are 5 vowels

patterns: What are the letters b, c, d, f, g, h, j, kâ€¦ called?
responses: They are called consonants

patterns: how many consonants are there in the alphabet
responses: there are 21 consonants in the alphabet
Consonants are letters that are not vowels., they can be at the beginning, middle or end of word
CVC stands for consonant + vowel + consonant .
A CVC pattern means consonant vowel consonant
An affix is a group of letters added to a root word to change its meaning.
An affix is either a prefix or a suffix.
Prefixes are a group of letters added at the beginning of a word to change its meaning.
-re, -un, -de, -mis, -over, -under, -non, -bi, and tri
-re, -un, -de, -mis, -over, -under, -non, -bi, and tri
Suffixes are a group of letters added at the end of a word to change its meaning.
-ly, -ous, -ness, -er, -en, -ment, -able, -less, -ion and -tion
Suffixes are group of letters added at the end of a word to change its meaning
A phonogram is a letter or combination of letters that represent a sound.
Noun is a word that describes a person, place, things

patterns: What are the types of nouns?
responses: There are 10 types of nouns: Common nouns, Proper nouns, Singular nouns, Plural nouns, Concrete nouns, Abstract nouns, Collective nouns, Compound nouns, Countable nouns , and Uncountable nouns.
Common nouns are words that refer to undefined or generic people, places, or things.

patterns: What are the examples of common nouns?
responses: Five examples of common nouns are: Man, Woman, Dog, Cat, Country
Proper nouns are words that help distinguish a specific person, place, or thing.
Proper nouns are words that refer to a specific person, place, or thing.

patterns: What are the examples of proper nouns?
responses: Five examples of proper nouns are names of a person, place, or thing like: Bob, Spain, Diary of a Wimpy Kid
Singular nouns are nouns that refer to only one person, place or thing.

patterns: What are the examples of singular nouns?
responses: Five examples of singular nouns are boat, house, cat, river
A plural noun are nouns that refer to more than one person, place, animal, thing, event, or idea.

patterns: What are the examples of plural nouns?
responses: Examples of plural nouns are: boats, houses, cats, dogs
A concrete noun is something that can be perceived through the five senses such as see, hear, touch, taste, or smell.
A abstract noun is something that cannot be perceived through the five senses such as see, hear, touch, taste, or smell.
A collective noun is a word that functions as a singular noun while referring to a group of people or things.
A compound noun combines two or more words into one but appears as a single word.
A compound words are formed when two words are put together to form a new word

patterns: what are the three types of compounding words
responses: we have the open compound, close compound and hypenated.

patterns: how is an open compound formed
responses: are formed when two words are separated by a space but are used together to create a new word with a specific meaning.

patterns: how is an close compound formed
responses: These are formed when two words are combined to create a new word.
These are formed when two separate words are joined together by a hyphen
A countable noun is a word that you can count.
Known as Count Noun, it is a word that signifies counting.
are nouns that can be counted or countable.
They have plural forms and numbers are used to count them
A uncountable noun is a word that you can't count.
Known as Mass Noun, it is a word that you can't signifies counting.
A countable noun is a word that you can count.
Known as Count Noun, it is a word that signifies counting.
A uncountable noun is a word that you can't count.
Known as Mass Noun, it is a word that you can't signifies counting.
A possessive noun is a noun that expresses ownership.

patterns: When will I add es to a noun if its plural
responses: If the noun ends in s, x, ch, sh, and z

patterns: When can I capialize a common noun
responses: We can capitalize a common noun if it's at the start of the sentence

patterns: What do I add to singular nouns ending with fe or f
responses: We change fe or f to v then add -es to form its plural.
A noun is a name that refers to a person, thing, animal, or event. Nouns help you name different things around you.
A singular noun means there is only one, it can be a person, thing, animal, place or event.
A plural noun means that there is more than one person, thing, animal, place, or event.
These are words that refer to general names of people, places, things, and events.
These nouns start with a small letter, and they do not begin with a capital letter.
These are words that refer to specific names of places, people, things, and events.
These nouns begin with a capital letter, and they do not begin with a small lette.

patterns: when will I change the noun the its plural form ?
responses: for regular nouns, add s.
for singular nouns ending in s, sh, x, ch, and z, add es.
for nouns ending in y preceded by a consonant, change y to i and add es
for nouns ending in o, add s or es
Plural nouns that do not end in the letter s or es are called irregular nouns.

patterns: What are the rules of irregular noun?
responses: Some nouns form their plural form by changing their vowels.
Some nouns form their plural form by adding a syllable
Some nouns that end in f, change f to -ve and add -s
Some nouns have the same singular and plural forms.
are nouns that can be counted or countable.
They have plural forms and numbers are used to count them
are nouns that cannot be counted or uncountable.
They don't have plural forms and they don't require articles before them.
is used to show ownership or possession.
names a group of people, things, and animals.
is used to group individual nouns
is mostly treated as singular even if it is comprised of multiple members
Pronouns are words that we use to replace nouns in sentences
Subject pronouns are usually found at the start of a sentence. We use pronouns to replace the nouns to avoid using nouns again and again

patterns: When do I use I in a sentence ?
responses: The pronoun I is used when a person is talking about himself or herself

patterns: When do I use you in a sentence ?
responses: The pronoun You is used when you address the person you are talking to.

patterns: When do I use We in a sentence ?
responses: The pronoun we is used when you talk about yourself and another person.

patterns: When do I use they in a sentence ?
responses: The pronoun they is used when you refer to a group of people or animals
A personal pronoun is a word used as a substitute for a person's name. It takes the place of a noun.

patterns: what are examples of singular personal pronoun
responses: examples of singular personal pronouns are I, Me, He, She, Him, Her, and It.

patterns: what are examples of plural personal pronoun
responses: examples of singular personal pronouns are We, Us, and you.
this are words used to point to something or someone.

patterns: what are examples of demonstrative noun
responses: this can be this, these, that, and those.

patterns: what are this as a demonstrative noun
responses: it is used to refer to a singular object that is near us or something that we can hold or touch.

patterns: what are these as a demonstrative noun
responses: it is used to refer to things that are more than one and are near us.

patterns: what are that as a demonstrative noun
responses: it is used to refer to a singular object that is far from us or something that we cant hold or touch

patterns: what are those as a demonstrative noun
responses: it is used to refer to things that are more than one and are far from us or something that we can't hold or touch.
Interrogative is from the word interrogate which means to ask
adjectives are describing word, we can use color size or shape.
The word is further explained by a noun or group of words that come after it. It is usually separated by commas in the sentence.
A descriptive text is a type of informational text that gives thorough details about a particular topic.

patterns: What are the types descriptive adjective
responses: We have common adjectives, and proper adjectives.
common adjectives are words that describe color, size, shape, taste, and texture and they do not start with capital letter.
proper adjectives are words that refer to the origin of the noun; start with a capital letter
Limiting adjectives limit a noun by specifying the noun being referred to. These adjectives usually answer the following questions:
words that are used to describe nouns and pronouns in a sentence

patterns: what are the three degree of comparison of an adjective
responses: we have positive, comparative, and supperlative

patterns: what is positive degree of comparison of an adjective
responses: It is the simple form used to describe a noun or a pronoun

patterns: what is comparative degree of comparison of an adjective
responses: Add er at the end of a word to form the comparative degree. For adjectives with three or more syllables, use less or more

patterns: what is superlative degree of comparison of an adjective
responses: Add est at the end of a word to form its superlative degree. For adjectives with three or more syllables, use least or most
A verb is an action word being done by the subject in the sentence.

patterns: How do sentences in the natural order
responses: In the natural order, the subject comes first before the verb.

patterns: How do sentences in the inverted order
responses: In inverted order, the verb comes first before the subject. Most questions are in this order.
A verb is a word that shows action.
It answers the question, What is he/she doing?
A linking verb connects the subject and the predicate or other information about the subject
Tense refers to the time indicated by the verb.
Past tense indicates that the action is already done.
Present tense indicates that the action is being done at the moment.
Future tense indicates that the action will be done in the future.

patterns: What is a simple present tense ?
responses: Simple present tense is used to talk about an action which happens every day, at the moment, or habitually.
A adverb is a word that describe or modify: verbs, adverbs, and adjectives

patterns: what is an adverb of manner
responses: describes a verb and answers the question how

patterns: what is an adverb of time
responses: describes a verb and answers the question when

patterns: what is an adverb of place
responses: describes a verb and answers the question where
a word that answers the question how, where, when, and how often
Prepositions are words that tell you the position of a thing or a person to another thing. It usually answers the question that begins with Where?
prepositions indicate where someone or something is
Sentences are a word or a group of words that express a complete thought.

patterns: How do sentences in the natural order
responses: In the natural order, the subject comes first before the verb.

patterns: How do sentences in the inverted order
responses: In inverted order, the verb comes first before the subject. Most questions are in this order.
Declarative is from the word declare which means to tell
Interrogative is from the word interrogate which means to ask
An imperative sentence expresses a command, request, or instruction.
An exclamatory sentence expresses strong emotions or feelings. It is often used in greetings and warnings.
A paragraph is a group of sentences that talks about one main idea or topic.
A main point is the most important message of the paragraph or text.
A main point is what the selection is mostly about.
A main point is what is being talked about in the paragraph.
It is a complete sentence that includes the topic and what the author wants to say. However, the main idea may or may not stated
Supporting details are other facts or sentences that support or explain the main idea.
Supporting details are major details explain and develop the main idea.
Supporting details are minor details help make the major details clear.
Interjections are words used to express a sudden feeling.
A graphic organizer is a teaching and learning tool used to organize information and ideas that are easy to comprehend and internalize.

A graphic organizer is a visual display that organizes ideas and shows the relationship between concepts or information. It guides readers in thinking and helping them more to comprehend what they read.

patterns: What are the examples of a reference material?
responses: Examples of reference materials are: Almanac, Encyclopedia, Index, Dictionary, Thesaurus ,Online resource/s
Reference materials are books and other reading materials that help in researching or answering questions.
An almanac contains specific facts, statistical data, and other information related to people, places, events, etc.
An encyclopedia contains basic information about a broad range of topics and is arranged alphabetically. It usually comes in volumes.
An index contains information present in periodicals, books, newspapers, etc.
A dictionary contains words of a given language and provides the definition(s), spelling, pronunciation, and the origin of a particular word.
A thesaurus is a book full of synonyms including antonyms.
